alert.note: Alert for Morton; Stevens (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 12:06AM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Morton and southwestern Stevens Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1206 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Feterita, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Feterita around 1215 AM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for southwestern Kansas.
